message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you an exclusive opportunity to purchase this valuable product. I believe it's a great fit for you, and I'm willing to start with a competitive price of $12,000. Let me know if you're interested!
I'm interested in the product, but $12,000 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle?

I understand you're looking for a better deal, Bob. However, I have to consider my own valuation of the product, and $9,000 is a bit too low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I can do $11,000. This is the best I can do for now.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $11,000 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $9,500. Can you consider this price?

I understand you're trying to find a sweet spot, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go below $11,000. I can offer you a slight discount, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm willing to meet you at $10,750. This is the lowest I can go for now.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $10,750, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $10,200. Can you consider this price?

I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I can see you're trying to get the best deal, and I respect that. However, I need to prioritize my own valuation of the product. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer you $10,500. This is as low as I can go.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, Alice, but $10,500 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $10,000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can meet in the middle.

I understand you're trying to finalize the deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product to you at $10,000. I've already made significant concessions, and I need to prioritize my own valuation. I'm willing to make one last attempt to meet you in the middle. I can offer you $10,250. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
